DF will get you

DP will get you
The caster gains the following bonuses: 1 extra hit point per caster level, strength is raised to 18 (if their strength is already 18 or higher, it is not raised further), and base attack bonus improves to that of a fighter of the same level.
which will vastly improve your #attacks and perhaps some extra str damage.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I know nothing about Arkhalia.

That said, these look like custom made monsters.

Since that is the case, only someone who is actually familiar with that particular environment can help you here (esp. since the log is not actually helping much - other than to tell you that your present weapon is apparently not effective enough to actually present a threat).

Immune normally refers to the creature in question actually being immune to either :

+3 and lower weapons (meaning you need higher than that - which threshold exactly is not determinable by the log feedback).
It could be the damage type - immunity to slashing.
DF should at least get you some magical damage on your weapon that automatically bypasses all immunities and reductions here.

You mention Cold Wrought weapons - this is not something that is innate to NWN.  That means custom scripting and custom creatures.  In that case, I would appeal to whatever rules and guidelines are available for the PW.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
As has already been posted, this is a problem with DI/DR and you will need to change weapons to fight them. That yellow message appears if your attacks do 0 damage, it doesn't necessarily mean that the problem is 100% DI or invulnerability. You need to check the actual logs to look at the DI/DR.

In vanilla NWN both Battletide and Divine Favour ignore DI/DR, but at your level this will mean only 2 damage per hit. Try using a different damage type (mace/sling for bludgeoning, shortsword/longbow for piercing), use elemental damage (although outsiders usually have elemental DI/DR), and try Searing Light or other damage spells. If using a different damage type works then I recommend carrying multiple types of weapons so you don't have a problem with DI/DR again.
